intro: Primula fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy, dark green leaves that are oval in shape. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. The fragrant scent of its flowers attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
